Why?

üññSpeaking The Right Language

There is a strong case for CSS being the de facto language to describe How a component is displayed.

CSS is the correct language to describe the way a web browser should display its rendered DOM elements. Here are a few really strong technical reasons why:

  • GPU Animation
  • Smaller build size, and DOM footprint over inline styling

However, the argument is stronger from an Organizational and Architectural position.

Melvin Conway, says it best in his famous adage dubbed Conway's Law:

Any organization that designs a system (defined more broadly here than just information systems) will inevitably produce a design whose structure is a copy of the organization's communication structure ~ Melvin Conway (Conway's Law)
